comment: Super enthusiastic and fun. I wish she showed up more often, most of the days were professionals from different engineering fields giving lectures. Assignments are very easy and only due like every 2 weeks.
The teacher was so good I decided to CE 1001L with the same exact teacher.
Genuinely the best professor I've ever had so far. She's effective at teaching, is fun to listen and talk to, and is oozes an infectious passion for what she teaches. Would 100% recommend.

Professor Worthy is very enthusiastic and cheerful. This class is basically a lecture class you don't really do anything other than an attendance quiz and assignments are doable online.
A very easy class to pass with a 100.


P.S the professor changes weekly for this class (so its different professors lecturing different types of engineering)
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: This review is for CE1001L. She is a little all over the place, but very clearly cares about students and she makes an effort to develop a one-on-one connection with everyone. The spaghetti bridge was fun, and shes good at making people collaborate.

Dr. Worthy is very laid back, humorous, and a lenient grader for this course. Attendance is mandatory, don't try to game the system, she might check if you take the attendance quiz and aren't in the room. 50% of the grade is attendance, the other 50% is from 6 or 7 very easy assignments throughout the term. Easy A, just show up and listen.

Probably one of the best classes I've taken at KSU. Teacher is super chill and lets you pick a project to do out of a couple at the end of the semester (projects change each semester). Other than that, assignments are super super easy. Try to just enjoy this class as a break from all your other hard classes.

She is such a fun teacher. This specific class was also really easy. If you did the assignment and showed up for class, you got a 100 in the class. There is no reason you shouldn't pass the class. She is the best
Dr. Worthy is a fun teacher. She is always in a good mood. We had one homework assignment a week and they were pretty easy. I would recommend her. She is a great teacher and person.

She is very nice and makes lectures entertaining. If you do the homework, you will get an A. Homework assignments are generally easy, no more than an hour max and only one per week. Excited to take her again for other classes. :)

Dr. Worthy's Fluids class was great. Just homework and exams. She laid out the course material in a very organized manner and made it clear what was expected of us each week. I recommend her to anyone taking Fluids.

She's the type of professor that makes learning fun. She is always ready to teach and keeps it relatable. I had close to no difficulties in this class, and if I did, I emailed her and she was the best helper. I wish he could teach all of my major classes

Dr. Worthy is the best! She taught this class so effortlessly. We had 5 or 6 HW assignments, 2 quizzes, and a final. Easy class if you study the textbook, watch the videos she posts, and do HW. The quizzes and exams were based on HW. I took it over the summer, online, so it was a bit fast-paced. Would highly recommend her

Dr. Worthy is the best professor ever. She is hilarious and caring. I had a great learning experience with CE 1000. She took her time explaining everything and her projects were very fun. The class had about an HW assignment every week and a project and paper at the end. If you do minimum work, it's an easy A in the class.

100% recommend Dr. Worthy's classes. She was super personable, and I enjoyed coming to class. She put in effort and it shows. There is one huge group project at the end but I liked it and the exposure it gave. Super easy class, just show up. Will take as many classes as she offers.

Her class was a very easy 100. All the work is straightforward, and you can complete it before class. She was also funny in class. There is no way you can fail this class as long as you turn in the assignments.

An extremely easy A as long as you do the work. You can work ahead. She wont grade anything till close to the end of the semester, but I finished with all 100s. You do have a service project that has pretty much nothing to do with the class, but you just write a reflection on it for an easy 100. Attendance isnt mandatory, shed is very sweet.

She has weekly assignments and a group project with a technical paper at the end. She grades really easy, you really just got to turn in the work. She is always making jokes so don't get offended. She cares for her students. Attendance isn't mandatory but she helps students more that show up to class. The group project and paper are a big part.
Very easy class. Mostly made up of a weekly discussion post. There is a group project that is a large portion of your grade at the end of the semester but it was a cool and fun assignment.
As long as you keep up with your weekly assignments, its an easy A. Great professor, she actually seems to care about her students and wants to have conversation!

Professor Worthy is good. Probably the only teacher Ive had in Spring at KSU that Id call good. Thats not because the class is easy: CE1000, but actually that she still makes the class interesting and hype you up to be an engineer. To me that matters a lot. Even though its not a hard or heavy class she still gives it her all & makes it worth it

Shes a great professor. Took her online and I feel like I actually learned a lot from her class. The assignments are pretty straightforward and easy. He lectures were legitimately interesting and she grabbed your attention very well. 10/10 very much would recommend!

One of my best profs yet. She was nice, seemed like she understood and cared about the material, was good at effectively communicating the information, was very understanding of students issues, and was helpful with any questions. Homework was completion grade, but def helped w/ understanding. Kahoot was occasionally given 4 extra credit on tests.

She is an amazing introductory professor. So sweet and inspirational, often hilarious as well. She is very open to communication and accessibility. Her introductory course is very easy and light on assignments. Just don't get lazy with it.

Class is really simple, everything is a completion grade but she will not accept late work. Class is not mandatory but she will jokingly call you out if you were late to class. In all the class is an easy A if you keep up with the weekly assignments.

I was conflicted about this rating. Overall the class was very organized (online), everything was posted from day 1, no surprises. There was weekly hw due Sun, easy quizzes, but the only test was the final. The prof. was kinda rude, snapped at us for emailing her with questions. Didn't show up to the final. Department final was brutal.

Dr. Worthy is very helpful for anything from class to career questions. She knows quite a lot about the civil/environmental fields however her classes, at least the higher up classes, are more lax in nature. Very good professor and even better contact for career possibilities.
Dr. Worthy is an awesome and engaging teacher. Although my class was simply an orientation class, she was devoted in lectures and took time to know us. If you turn in something, you'll get a 100.
Easy A. If you do the assignments you get a 100. She is more worried about getting you prepared for jobs than doing things in class. I will definitely take her upper level classes!

Dr. Worthy is great! She is very funny and spends time on the first day getting to know that class. I have her for Intro to Civil Engineering and it is very easy. I have the class once a week for 50 minutes. We only have one or two assignments a week. She tells you in the beginning that the class will be easy because its only a 1 credit course.

I'm like pretty sure she didn't grade half the assignments she told us to. As long as you turn something in, you'll get credit for it. By the end of the year, I just stopped going. She understood it was only a 1 credit course and made the class easy and fun. Very talkative and easy going.
Hands down best Fluids professor at KSU. Great class format, very well structured. Amazing grader. Take this class if you're worried about your grade, and want to not stress about fluids.

Professor Worthy classes are awesome, she a great professor. What she lectures and gives for hw is what you need to study simple as that. She try's to make the subject matter easy on you but guess what you picked engineering what did you expect. By the time your done reading this her class is probable already full. Everyone took your spot.
I wouldn't take her. I took her for intro. My friend told me there's a better teacher who does CE1000 in the spring and summer that's really good.

Very entertaining. I felt like the class could have been done in a more cohesive way where we learned more about Civil Engineering. I did appreciate that she had dates for the entire semester set. There were only two homework assignments for us, which were easy A's. I don't know if I would take her for a more serious subject, but I did enjoy class.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: She is a great professor who really cares about her students. She is very open and receptive to students.

Prof. Worthy is very nice, fair, and personable, but she didn't seem to put enough effort into teaching the finer points of fluid mechanics. Unfortunately, our class learned the hard way during the department final that the details were important. I'm not sure if I would recommend her for this particular class (maybe maybe not).
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She is a great person but not a great professor. It is an easy A until you get to the final exam which is brutal (there were 3 different versions of the final exam!). She did not teach much all semester long. She was in Europe all of October so our midterm was online and it was an easy A. If you want to learn, avoid but take if you want an easy A/B

Wonderful professor. CE 1000 is a pretty simple class. Nearly every assignment is online and not due until the end of the semester. We had one simple group project that took some time to organize, but it worked out well. I would attend class because she gives useful insight into Civil Engineering fields. Recommend!

Hands down the best professor I've ever had! She makes everything so clear and understanding. If you put in the work, you will get at least a B. That's not to say you won't learn because you will walk away with a wealth of knowledge.

Dr. Worthy is an amazing person. She has such a great personality and is very passionate about the subject. She basically gives you an "A". She does assign homework, but it's not a lot. Test pretty much come straight from the homework. She is willing to help anyone who needs it. I would defiantly recommend taking her if you get the chance.

She took the class step-by-step through the material so you never felt lost.  She took attendance but got pretty lenient on it at the end of the semester.  Tests and quizzes are easy if you do the homework (it's not a lot of homework).  And she's very welcoming if you ask questions during class, at her office, or even call her on the phone.

Hands down one of the best professors I've ever had. She's very clear and breaks down material into simple and easy to understand concepts. If you don't understand something, she'll take time and explain it in class or at her office during hours. She's super understanding and wants you to do well in her class. Plus, a bonus is she's pretty funny.
